metadata.description: Definition of Done scenarios and criteria for DoD Creation Workshop

scenarios.title: E-commerce Web Application
scenarios.description: Building features for an online shopping platform with high traffic and strict security requirements
scenarios.context: Your team is developing features for a major e-commerce platform that handles thousands of transactions daily. Quality and security are paramount.

categories.title: Technical Standards
categories.description: Code quality, architecture, and technical implementation requirements

categories.title: Functional Requirements
categories.description: Feature completeness, user experience, and business logic validation

categories.title: Process & Workflow
categories.description: Development workflow, reviews, and team collaboration requirements

categories.title: Documentation & Knowledge
categories.description: Documentation, knowledge sharing, and maintainability requirements

availableCriteria.text: Code reviewed by at least one other team member
availableCriteria.rationale: Catches bugs early and ensures knowledge sharing

availableCriteria.text: Unit tests written with minimum 80% code coverage
availableCriteria.rationale: Ensures code reliability and prevents regressions

availableCriteria.text: Integration tests pass for all affected components
availableCriteria.rationale: Validates component interactions work correctly

availableCriteria.text: All acceptance criteria met and verified
availableCriteria.rationale: Ensures feature meets business requirements

availableCriteria.text: Security vulnerability scan completed with no high-risk issues
availableCriteria.rationale: Critical for e-commerce platform security

availableCriteria.text: Performance tests meet response time requirements
availableCriteria.rationale: Ensures good user experience under load

availableCriteria.text: UI/UX reviewed and approved by design team
availableCriteria.rationale: Maintains consistent user experience

availableCriteria.text: Accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA) compliance verified
availableCriteria.rationale: Ensures inclusive user experience

availableCriteria.text: Technical documentation updated to reflect changes
availableCriteria.rationale: Maintains system knowledge for future development

availableCriteria.text: API documentation updated if endpoints changed
availableCriteria.rationale: Essential for API consumers and integration

availableCriteria.text: Deployment process tested in staging environment
availableCriteria.rationale: Prevents production deployment issues

availableCriteria.text: Rollback plan documented and tested
availableCriteria.rationale: Enables quick recovery from deployment issues

availableCriteria.text: Monitoring and alerting configured for new features
availableCriteria.rationale: Enables proactive issue detection

availableCriteria.text: Tested across supported browsers and devices
availableCriteria.rationale: Ensures consistent experience across platforms

availableCriteria.text: Data migration scripts tested and documented
availableCriteria.rationale: Critical for data integrity in production

availableCriteria.text: User training materials updated if workflow changes
availableCriteria.rationale: Helps users adapt to new features

availableCriteria.text: Regulatory compliance requirements verified
availableCriteria.rationale: Essential for e-commerce legal requirements

availableCriteria.text: Error handling and user feedback implemented
availableCriteria.rationale: Provides clear user guidance when issues occur

availableCriteria.text: Appropriate logging added for debugging and monitoring
availableCriteria.rationale: Enables effective troubleshooting

availableCriteria.text: Feature flags configured for gradual rollout
availableCriteria.rationale: Allows safe feature deployment and testing

excellent.message: Excellent! You've created a comprehensive Definition of Done that covers all critical quality aspects. Your categorization shows strong understanding of different quality dimensions.

good.message: Good work! Your Definition of Done covers most important areas. Consider adding a few more criteria in the areas you might have missed.

needsImprovement.message: Your Definition of Done is a good start, but it's missing some critical quality gates. Review the feedback to strengthen your quality standards.

insufficient.message: Your Definition of Done needs significant improvement. A comprehensive DoD should cover technical, functional, process, and documentation aspects.
